Transgress not with hand or foot (2)lg==
restrain speech and be cautious in actionlg==
Always delight in meditation within,lg==
Practise solitude (3) and be silent (4).lg==
Learn to be controlled in tongue,lg==
Moderate in speed (5), and not excited (6),lg==
Bound (7) to [expounding] the meaning and Dharma (8);lg==
Make sure to be gentle in speech (9).lg==
6ne who is fond of the Dharma, delight in the Dharma,lg==
Ponders over and confides in Dharma,lg==
-Such a bhiksu, following the Dharma,lg==
Is upright [in the Dharma], and wastes no effort (10).lg==
In training one should not seek gain (11),lg==
Nor should one course coveting others.lg==
A bhiksu who covets others,lg==
Cannot attain to concentration (12).lg==
A bhisu who seeks little,lg==
And accumulates not with what he gets (13)lg==
Is praised by gods and men,lg==
Having a pure life, untainted (14).lg==
A bhiksu who practises kindness,lg==
Who loves and respects the Buddha's Teaching,lg==
Who is deep into concentration and insight (15);lg==
Attains happiness when the conditionings (16) cease (17).lg==
All mental and physical objectslg==
Are unreal; don't be deluded.lg==
He who grieves not when they are not near,lg==
Is truly a bhiksu (19).lg==
Bhiksu! bail water out from the boat!lg==
When empty within, it becomes light.lg==
When greed, hatred and ignorance are removed,lg==
This is Nirvana (20).lg==
Abandon five, cut off five (21),lg==
And meditate on the five faculties (22).lg==
He who can analyzes the five [fetters]lg==
Thereby crosses over the river (23).lg==
Meditate without being heedless.lg==
Do not let desires disperse [your mind].lg==
Do not swallow a [red-hot] copper,lg==
And then be vexed at the body being burnt (24).lg==
There is no meditation (25) for one without wisdom;lg==
No wisdom for one without meditation.lg==
Enlightenment (26) is born of meditation and wisdom;lg==
[With them] one can reach Nirvana (27).lg==
One should (28) learn to enter into empty;lg==
Go into retreat to calm the mind;lg==
Delight in solitude;lg==
And one-mindedly contemplate on the Dharma (29).lg==
One should subdue the five skandhas;lg==
And overcome the mind to be like water (30),lg==
Peaceful and calm,lg==
-This is the taste of ambrosia (31).lg==
He who accepts not what he [already] has,lg==
-This is a wise bhiksu.lg==
He is controlled in the sense, and content,lg==
And observes all the disciplinary rules (32).lg==
Let his life be pure in conduct;lg==
Let him seek spiritual friends;lg==
Let the wise fulfil others' [need];lg==
[Thereby] transcending suffering to find bliss (33).lg==
Just like Jasmine flowers (34),lg==
Which fall of themselves on withering;lg==
When greed, hatred, and ignorance are removed,lg==
Transmigration is automatically transcended (35).lg==
Calm in body, and speech,lg==
Mind ever remaining quiescent;lg==
A bhiksu who loathes the worldlylg==
Is said to have experienced tranquillity (36).lg==
One should command one's body (37),lg==
And within, struggle with one's mind.lg==
Guarding his body and mindful of the Truth,lg==
A bhiksu lives happily (38).lg==
One is one's own Self.lg==
The no-existent being reckoned [as real], the self exists.lg==
Therefore subdue (39) the self;lg==
When tamed it will be like a fine [horse] (40).lg==
[A bhiksu] joyful in the Buddha's teaching,lg==
Will, with much joy,lg==
Attain to quiescence,lg==
The cessation of conditionings and eternal bliss (41).lg==
He who while young (42)practiseslg==
In accordance with the Buddha's Teaching;lg==
Illumines the world,lg==
Like the sun free from clouds (43).lg==
Completely without conceit and deceit (44);lg==
Untainted like lotus in water,lg==
He learns to give up this and that,lg==
Knowing this to be the superior way (45).lg==
Craving removed, without longings,lg==
Not liable to being tainted, like a lotus;lg==
A bhiksu will thereby cross the river,lg==
For, desires being conquered understanding arises.lg==
Stop the stream [of desire] and reflect (46) yourselflg==
Turn back (47) your mind from desire,lg==
Unless you (48) cut off desire,lg==
Your one-mindedness will still (49) slip away (50).lg==
Do it, do it- [persevere];lg==
Control yourself with strength.lg==
If, having left home you get slack,lg==
Your mind will get defiled againg (51).lg==
He who is slack in his practice,lg==
Not ending the tiring thoughts (52),lg==
Is not living a life of puritylg==
-How then can be reach the Great Gem (53).lg==
Sramana, wither are your coursing?lg==
If your mind is not controlled,lg==
Step by step you'll get stuck,lg==
Being dragged on only by [lustful] thoughts (54).lg==
He who, though with the robe over the shoulders,lg==
Restrain not his evil acts;lg==
He is the worst of evil doers (55),lg==
And will fall into evil destinies (56).lg==
[Mind] being untamed, discipline become difficult;lg==
One is [helpless] as a rotten tree against the wind.lg==
What one does is for one's own sake (57)lg==
-So why not strive hard (58)!lg==
A 'ceased-mind' (59) is not one with a shaven head,lg==
While being arrogant and unruly.lg==
Giving up greed and mindful of the Way (60),lg==
One becomes worthy of being a 'ceased-mind' (61)lg==
A 'ceased mind' is not one [simply] with a shaven headlg==
While being heedless and faithless.lg==
He who can end all sufferings,lg==
Is a superior sramana (62).lg==

div.head:
梵志品《法句經》第三十五有四十章
The chapter on 'The Brahmana' (1)

p.seg: Stop the stream [of craving] (2) and cross over,lg==
Be desireless like a brahma;lg==
Having known the exhaustion of conditionings,lg==
One is indeed a brahmana (3).lg==
By means of the non-dual dharma (4),lg==
He is purified and crosses the sea;lg==
All his fetters of desire are removedlg==
-Such a one is brahmana (5).lg==
He who is at ease (6) with other and no-other (7);lg==
For whom [both] other, [not] other, are void;lg==
He who gives up sensual craving;lg==
Is indeed a brahmana (8)lg==
He who is meditative, stainless;lg==
Whose deeds are corruption-free;lg==
In whom there does not arise higher seeking (9);lg==
Is indeeda a brahmana (10).lg==
The sun glows by day;lg==
The moon shines by night;lg==
The warrior shines in the army;lg==
In meditation glows the spiritual cultivator.lg==
The Buddha appears in the world,lg==
Illuminating to dispel darkness everywhere (11).lg==
One is not a brahmana on account of the shaven head;lg==
Nor is one a brahmana because one utters mantras (12).lg==
It is one who gives up all evillg==
Whom may be called a spiritual cutivator (13).lg==
A brahmana is one who exists from evil;lg==
A brahmana is one who enters rectitude.lg==
Having renounced ones own defiled deeds (14).lg==
One is regarded as having left ome (15).lg==
If one is calmed (16) with regard to the pleasantlg==
And at hearty attaches to naughtlg==
-Having [thus] renounced and rectified [attachment]lg==
One extinguishes all sefferings (17).lg==
He whose body, speech and mindlg==
Are pure without any fault;lg==
Who is restrained (18) in this threefold action,lg==
Is indeed a brahmana (19).lg==
If your mind understandslg==
The Teachings of the Buddha;lg==
Look into your mind and take refuge in yourself,lg==
[As a brahmana] purifies himself with water (20).lg==
Neither on account of clan nor matted hairs.lg==
Is one called a brahmana.lg==
He whose deeds are truthful and righteous,lg==
He is pure, and this makes him a virtous one (21).lg==
What for is your contrived hair, witless one!lg==
What for your straw clothes?lg==
When within your remain attached,lg==
What's the use of external renunciation (22)?lg==
He who wear poor cclothes,lg==
Who personally practises the dharma,lg==
Who meditates on retreat,lg==
-Is indeed a brahmana (23).lg==
The Buddha does not teach onelg==
To elevate oneself and make self-claims;lg==
One according with truth, and undeceitful,lg==
May be called a brahmana (24).lg==
He who giving up all objects of craving,lg==
Does not vex his mind with lust (25).lg==
Who renounces all that pertains to craving;lg==
Is indeed a brahmana (26).lg==
He who has cut off the river of transmigration (27),lg==
Who has forbearance and transcends [the world] (28),lg==
Who is self-awakened and out of the moats (29);lg==
Is indeed a brahmana (30).lg==
He who in the face of being abused and hit,lg==
Endures quietly without anger;lg==
Who has the power of patience;lg==
Is indeed a brahmana (31).lg==
He who, in the face of being attacked,lg==
Does naught but remains mindful of his precepts;lg==
Who maintains proper (32) postures, self-controlled;lg==
Is indeed a brahmana (33).lg==
He who abandons evil dharmas in his mind,lg==
Like a snake shedding its skin;lg==
And is not tainted by desire,lg==
Is indeed a brahmana (34).lg==
He who realizes life to be unsatisfactory,lg==
And thereby ceases to have [sensual] thoughts (35);lg==
Who can lay down the burden;lg==
Is indeed a brahmana (36).lg==
He who understands and has profound wisdom;lg==
Who distinguishes the right and wrong paths;lg==
And who has reached the high[est] goal (37);lg==
Is called a brahmana (38).lg==
He can give up the household life,lg==
And has no fear (39) of the household;lg==
Who has few needs and little desire;lg==
Is indeed a brahmana (41).lg==
He who let free living things,lg==
Who harbours no thoughts of killing,lg==
Who causes afflictions to no-one,lg==
Is indeed a brahmana (41).lg==
He avoids disputes,lg==
Who resents not when offended,lg==
Who is friendly to the hostile;lg==
Is indeed a brahmana (44).lg==
He removes greed, anger, delusion,lg==
Conceit and other evil,lg==
Like a snake shedding its skin (43);lg==
Is indeed a brahmana (44).lg==
He who is cut off from worldly assosiations;lg==
Who utters no harsh words;lg==
Who carefully investigates the Eight-fold Path;lg==
Is indeed a brahmana (45).lg==
Those considered by the world as good or bad (46),lg==
Those which are long, short, thick, thinlg==
-He takes not [any of them] which is not given (47);lg==
Such a one is a brahmana (48).lg==
One's deeds being pure in this life,lg==
There can be no defilement in the life after.lg==
[Thus] without practising any [evil dharmas] (49).lg==
-One is called a brahmana (50).lg==
Renouncing the body, without a supporting basis (51),lg==
Not reciting [the doctrines] of other discipline;lg==
He attains the Deathless Cessation.lg==
Such a one is a brahmana (52).lg==
He who, with regard to good and evil,lg==
Ha got rid of both these deeds (53),lg==
Free from sorrow and dust,lg==
Is indeed a brahmana (54).lg==
He whose mind is joyful, stainlesslg==
Like a moon in its fullness,lg==
Who is free from defamation,lg==
Is indeed a brahmana (55).lg==
Seeing that the fools, in coming and going,lg==
Fall into the moats to suffer;lg==
He desires to cross over the other shore alone,lg==
Disregarding the words of others.lg==
Only he in whom [birth] ceases and arises no more,lg==
May be called a brahmana (56).lg==
He who has cut off lust,lg==
Who is homeless, desireless,lg==
Whose lust for existence is destroyedlg==
May be called a brahmana (57).lg==
He who is away from the human communitylg==
And does not fall into the celestial community.lg==
-Not going to any community what so ever;lg==
May be called a brahmana (58).lg==
He who has given up pleasure and despleasure;lg==
Who is extinguished, without heat remnant;lg==
Heroic, defeating the whole world;lg==
Is indeed a brahmana (59).lg==
He for whom birth is no more,lg==
And at death is without destination;lg==
Who is awakened, happy and detached;lg==
Is indeed a brahmana (60).lg==
He who has transcended the five destinies;lg==
Whose destination [at death] cannot be known;lg==
Who has completely destroyed all habits (61);lg==
Is indeed a brahmana (62).lg==
He for whom, before and after,lg==
And (63) in the middle, there is naught;lg==
Without holding on, without discarding (64);lg==
He is indeed a brahmana (65).lg==
The most heroic, the most fearless,lg==
-He who is self-released,lg==
Who is enlightened, and whose mind is unshaken,lg==
Is indeed a brahmana (66).lg==
He who knows his past lives,lg==
And his previous transmigrations:lg==
Who has the means for ending birth;lg==
Whose insight penetrates the highest profundity;lg==
Who is wise like a silent-one (67);lg==
Is indeed a brahmana (68).lg==
